intro: Loeselia tancitaroensis, commonly known as the Tancitaro loeselia, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. It features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the spring. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
